fields.name: CKPOL
fields.description: Parallel data clock polarity This bit configures the capture edge of the parallel clock or the edge used for driving outputs, depending on OUTEN.

fields.name: DEPOL
fields.description: Data enable (PSSI_DE) polarity This bit indicates the level on the PSSI_DE pin when the data are not valid on the parallel interface.

fields.name: RDYPOL
fields.description: Ready (PSSI_RDY) polarity This bit indicates the level on the PSSI_RDY pin when the data are not valid on the parallel interface.

fields.name: ENABLE
fields.description: PSSI enable The contents of the FIFO are flushed when ENABLE is cleared to 0. Note: When ENABLE=1, the content of PSSI_CR must not be changed, except for the ENABLE bit itself. All configuration bits can change as soon as ENABLE changes from 0 to 1. The DMA controller and all PSSI configuration registers must be programmed correctly before setting the ENABLE bit to 1. The ENABLE bit and the DCMI ENABLE bit (bit 15 of DCMI_CR) must not be set to 1 at the same time.

fields.name: DERDYCFG
fields.description: Data enable and ready configuration When the PSSI_RDY function is mapped to the PSSI_DE pin (settings 101 or 111), it is still the RDYPOL bit which determines its polarity. Similarly, when the PSSI_DE function is mapped to the PSSI_RDY pin (settings 110 or 111), it is still the DEPOL bit which determines its polarity.

fields.name: OVR_ISC
fields.description: Data buffer overrun/underrun interrupt status clear Writing this bit to 1 clears the OVR_RIS bit in PSSI_RIS.

fields.name: OVR_MIS
fields.description: Data buffer overrun/underrun masked interrupt status This bit is set to 1 only when PSSI_IER/OVR_IE and PSSI_RIS/OVR_RIS are both set to 1.

fields.name: OVR_RIS
fields.description: Data buffer overrun/underrun raw interrupt status This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the OVR_ISC bit in PSSI_ICR.

fields.name: RTT4B
fields.description: FIFO is ready to transfer four bytes.

fields.name: RTT1B
fields.description: FIFO is ready to transfer one byte.

variants.name: FallingEdge
variants.description: Falling edge active for inputs or rising edge active for outputs.

variants.name: RisingEdge
variants.description: Rising edge active for inputs or falling edge active for outputs.

variants.name: ActiveLow
variants.description: PSSI_DE active low (0 indicates that data is valid).

variants.name: ActiveHigh
variants.description: PSSI_DE active high (1 indicates that data is valid).

variants.name: RdyDeAlt
variants.description: Both PSSI_RDY and PSSI_DE alternate functions enabled.

variants.name: RdyDe
variants.description: Both PSSI_RDY and PSSI_DE features enabled - bidirectional on PSSI_RDY pin.

variants.name: RdyRemapped
variants.description: Only PSSI_RDY function enabled, but mapped to PSSI_DE pin.

variants.name: DeRemapped
variants.description: Only PSSI_DE function enabled, but mapped to PSSI_RDY pin.

variants.name: RdyDeBidi
variants.description: Both PSSI_RDY and PSSI_DE features enabled - bidirectional on PSSI_DE pin.

variants.name: BitWidth8
variants.description: Interface captures 8-bit data on every parallel data clock.

variants.name: BitWidth16
variants.description: The interface captures 16-bit data on every parallel data clock.

variants.name: ReceiveMode
variants.description: Data is input synchronously with PSSI_PDCK.

variants.name: TransmitMode
variants.description: Data is output synchronously with PSSI_PDCK.

variants.name: ActiveLow
variants.description: PSSI_RDY active low (0 indicates that the receiver is ready to receive).

variants.name: ActiveHigh
variants.description: PSSI_RDY active high (1 indicates that the receiver is ready to receive).
